channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SPR-1748] Spring Form Input Tag Does Not Respect spring:nestedPath Tag
item.description:
The <spring-form:input> tag does not respect the <spring:nestedPath> tag.

Example:

<spring:nestedPath path="name">
<tr>
<td class="form-label"><label for="name.first">First Name:</label></td>
<td class="form-field"><spring-form:input path="first"/></td>
</tr>
</spring:nestedPath>

This generates the error:

org.springframework.beans.NotReadablePropertyException: Invalid property 'first' of bean class [com.apress.beginning_spring.chap8.domain.Player]: Bean property 'first' is not readable or has an invalid getter method: Does the return type of the getter match the parameter type of the setter?

This is because the outer object is of class Player, but the input field is for a property on a Player's Name object.
item.summary: Spring Form Input Tag Does Not Respect spring:nestedPath Tag

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This may not be fixed yet. I think the error is on line 149 of AbstractDataBoundFormElementTag. The getAttribute() call should specify PageContext.REQUEST_SCOPE.

<spring-form:form action="" commandName="player">
<table>
<tbody>
<spring:nestedPath path="name">
<tr>
<td class="form-label"><label for="name.first">First Name:</label></td>
<td class="form-field"><spring-form:input path="first"/></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td class="form-label"><label for="name.last">Last Name:</label></td>
<td class="form-field"><spring-form:input path="last"/></td>
</tr>
</spring:nestedPath>

and I get the error:

Mar 2, 2006 12:52:38 AM org.springframework.web.servlet.tags.RequestContextAwareTag doStartTag
SEVERE: Invalid property 'first' of bean class [com.apress.beginning_spring.chap8.domain.Player]: Bean property 'first' is not readable or has an invalid getter method: Does the return type of the getter match the parameter type of the setter?
org.springframework.beans.NotReadablePropertyException: Invalid property 'first' of bean class [com.apress.beginning_spring.chap8.domain.Player]: Bean property 'first' is not readable or has an invalid getter method: Does the return type of the getter match the parameter type of the setter?
at org.springframework.beans.BeanWrapperImpl.getPropertyValue(BeanWrapperImpl.java:488)
at org.springframework.beans.BeanWrapperImpl.getPropertyValue(BeanWrapperImpl.java:480)
at org.springframework.validation.BeanBindingResult.getActualFieldValue(BeanBindingResult.java:97)
at org.springframework.validation.AbstractBindingResult.getFieldValue(AbstractBindingResult.java:302)
at org.springframework.web.servlet.support.BindStatus.<init>(BindStatus.java:115)
at org.springframework.web.servlet.tags.form.AbstractDataBoundFormElementTag.getBindStatus(AbstractDataBoundFormElementTag.java:122)
at org.springframework.web.servlet.tags.form.AbstractDataBoundFormElementTag.getValue(AbstractDataBoundFormElementTag.java:112)
at org.springframework.web.servlet.tags.form.InputTag.writeValue(InputTag.java:146)
at org.springframework.web.servlet.tags.form.InputTag.writeTagContent(InputTag.java:129)
at org.springframework.web.servlet.tags.form.AbstractFormTag.doStartTagInternal(AbstractFormTag.java:81)
at org.springframework.web.servlet.tags.RequestContextAwareTag.doStartTag(RequestContextAwareTag.java:68)
at org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.registerPlayer_jsp._jspx_meth_spring$1form_input_0(org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.registerPlayer_jsp:236)
at org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.registerPlayer_jsp._jspService(org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.registerPlayer_jsp:100)
at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:97)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:802)
at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.service(JspServletWrapper.java:332)
at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.serviceJspFile(JspServlet.java:314)
at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:264)

Patch (seems to work with this):

Index: AbstractDataBoundFormElementTag.java
===================================================================
RCS file: /cvsroot/springframework/spring/src/org/springframework/web/servlet/tags/form/AbstractDataBoundFormElementTag.java,v
retrieving revision 1.4
diff -u -r1.4 AbstractDataBoundFormElementTag.java
— AbstractDataBoundFormElementTag.java 28 Feb 2006 17:22:52 -0000 1.4
+++ AbstractDataBoundFormElementTag.java 2 Mar 2006 11:17:19 -0000
@@ -21,6 +21,7 @@
import org.springframework.web.servlet.tags.NestedPathTag;

import javax.servlet.jsp.JspException;
+import javax.servlet.jsp.PageContext;

/**

  • Base tag for all data-binding aware JSP form tags. Provides the common
    @@ -101,7 +102,7 @@
  • changing the bind path.
    */
    protected String getName() throws JspException { - return getPath(); + return getPropertyPath(getPath()); }

/**
@@ -133,20 +134,27 @@
StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
sb.append(getCommandName()).append('.');

  • String nestedPath = getNestedPath();
    + return sb.append(getPropertyPath(resolvedSubPath)).toString();
    + }
    +
    + private String getPropertyPath(String resolvedSubPath) {
    + StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
    +
    + String nestedPath = getNestedPath();
    if(nestedPath != null) { - sb.append(nestedPath).append('.'); + sb.append(nestedPath); }

return sb.append(resolvedSubPath).toString();

  • }
    + }

/**

  • Gets the value of the nested path that may have been exposed by the
  • {@link NestedPathTag}

    .
    */
    private String getNestedPath()

    { - String nestedPath = (String) this.pageContext.getAttribute(NestedPathTag.NESTED_PATH_VARIABLE_NAME); + String nestedPath = (String) this.pageContext.getAttribute( + NestedPathTag.NESTED_PATH_VARIABLE_NAME, PageContext.REQUEST_SCOPE); return nestedPath; }
